title: Sariska National Park
short_description: A tiger reserve in the Aravalli hills, known for the first successful tiger relocation program and ancient temples.
long_description: Sariska Tiger Reserve is located in the Alwar district of Rajasthan. The topography of Sariska supports scrub-thorn arid forests, rocky landscapes, dry deciduous forests, rocks, grasses and hilly cliffs. This park is famous for the Sariska Palace, which was used by the Maharaja of Alwar as a hunting lodge, and for being the first reserve in the world with successfully relocated tigers. Apart from wildlife, it houses the medieval Kankwari Fort and the ancient Neelkanth Mahadev Temple, adding a historical dimension to the safari.
wildlife_significance: First tiger reserve where tiger relocation and reintroduction was successfully attempted.
guides_and_tips: Private vehicles allowed only on Tuesdays/Saturdays for temple visits (strict rules). Safaris best booked online.
how_to_reach: By Air: Jaipur (110 km) or Delhi (200 km). By Rail: Alwar (36 km).
permits_and_fees: Booking via Rajasthan Government Forest Dept portal.
conservation_notes: Monitoring of relocated tigers is intensive using radio collars.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Sariska. Afternoon Safari. Day 2: Morning Safari. Visit Pandupol and Kankwari Fort. Evening leisure. Day 3: Departure via Alwar (visit City Palace).
safety_tips: Leopards are common; do not walk alone at night even in resort peripheries.

operating_season.season_notes: Check status before monsoon travel; sometimes Pandupol route stays open.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Weekends see heavy rush from Delhi/Jaipur.
